title: What is this typeface? Georges Logo
content:
What ho!

hopefully this will be a simple one.... what is the typeface please?

chin chin

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/georges_logo_3872.jpg)

 [‹ Font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41262 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sorta 70's Style Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41429 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ashley.666

comments.content:
Thank you sir!

Modern no 20 is similar but not quite the same.

Seems pretty close to Pistilli Roman, although this ’s’ looks thinner. We’ve talked about this typeface before, and if there is a digital version, that may be what this is. The sample I am seeing is in the Phil’s Photo ’Homage to the Alphabet’ book, and is a film type.

- Mike Yanega

A quick Google search of Typophile found several places where we talked about Phil Martin’s [Didoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/didoni/) being the closest digital version to Pistilli Roman. I think that might be your answer.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you, that is much closer. I appreciate both of your assistance.

i’ve loved Pistilli ever since Mark mentioned it a few years back. (actually Nov. 2003)

here’s Pistilli

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/scan3_3951.jpg)

sample

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/georges_logo_3872_5296.jpg)

didoni

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/didoni_3415.jpg)

this mark is from a restaurant in Philadelphia ...

perhaps it’s an offshoot of the font they are using on the site?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/g2_4696.jpg)

[link to the first Pistilli thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043/http:/typophile.com/node/2156)

Thank you very much Pistilli is great. Has it been made digital or is there just Didoni?

bjharvey, any relation to Polly Jean?

ashley, there’s a link below the above graphic to the first Pistilli thread. No, it hasn’t been made digital.

re: nickname ... old name from 6 years ago when I happened to be listening to Polly Jean a bit. :)

hi ashley,  
why don’t you email the designer  
i’m sure he’ll help you out!

[http://www.fluxism.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080129100043/http:/www.fluxism.com/ "http://www.fluxism.com/")
